title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 March 2009 - XWiki
content:

asiri - (24/03/2009 09:48): ChathuraPrabuddh: Hi  
asiri - (24/03/2009 09:48): ChathuraPrabuddh: btw, you should get a short IRC name ;)  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 09:49): ya  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 09:50): thanks for replying mee  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 09:50): thanks for replying mee  
asiri - (24/03/2009 09:50): np..

XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:22): hello  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:24): Macros.FootnoteMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.hel (Added comment) - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/FootnoteMacro  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:24): is there anyone can talk?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:30): hello XKLL  
W\_work - (24/03/2009 14:30): No, I'm a mute. I write rather well though.  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 14:31): Hai guys  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:33): XKLL, if you're interested in a GSOC project you can talk with sdumitriu when he'll be online  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:33): thanks muck  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 14:33): Did'nt see sdumitriu whole day  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:34): you welcome XKLL  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:34): :)  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:42): little question  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:43): who is the best person to talk with about this project: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/XWikiCrossPlatformWebandDesktopWidget2009  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:43): :)  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:45): maybe no bigfish is here  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:46): DevGuide.Pagination was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeLerouge - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Pagination  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:46): DevGuide.ListOfResults was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeLerouge - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/ListOfResults  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:46): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeLerouge - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:46): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeLerouge - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:47): DevGuide.SuggestBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeLerouge - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SuggestBox  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:47): XKLL, what project are u interested in?  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:48): Import from other popular blogging platforms.      
XKLL - (24/03/2009 14:48): i am a little fish  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:49): :)  
lucaa - (24/03/2009 14:50): alexmaru: I think the best to talk about the widgets project, is Ludovic, as the leader field in the proj description says it. But you won't find him too often on IRC... Write a mail on the list!  
lucaa - (24/03/2009 14:51): well, he should be here actually: ldubost  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:51): hi  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:52): typing my name works  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:52): hello ldubost  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:52): Hi alex.. how are you  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:52): so you have questions about widgets  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:52): fine, thanks  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:52): yes  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:53): I'm interested in this project  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 14:53): GoogleSummerOfCode.XEclipseWTPSourceEditing was modified by xwiki:XWiki.JeromeVelociter - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/XEclipseWTPSourceEditing  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:53): are u gonna be the mentor?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:53): could be could be not :)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:53): I think it kind of depends  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:53): we would probably decide mentors in the end  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:54): because I'm not sure I can mentor more than one or max 2 projects  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:54): I already started talking with sdumitiru  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:54): and he gave me some nice tips  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:54): so it depends what the project list ends up with  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:54): you are talking about this one ?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:54): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/XWikiCrossPlatformWebandDesktopWidget2009  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:54): yes  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:55): so the project is about developing as many widgets as possible, right?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:55): and using the REST API   
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:56): for getting data  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:56): anyway of getting data.. it could be done in wiki scripts also  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:57): I thought I had put a project for gadgets integration in xwiki (and opensocial)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:57): but apparently not  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:57): We already have some sample Google Gadget that works   
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 14:57): where? :)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:57): but we need to do much better and more relevant  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:58): let me check  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:58): I have one on news.myxwiki.org  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 14:59): http://news.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GadgetCode/PublicNewsGadget  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:00): http://news.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GadgetCode/PublicNewsGadget?viewer=code  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:00): http://news.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GadgetCode/PublicNewsGadgetService?viewer=code&showlinenumbers=0  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:00): There is also supporting Google Gadgets the other way around  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:00): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Gadgets/  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:01): okay  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:01): I'll take a look  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:01): thank you  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:01): :)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:01): The last one is quite advanced  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:01): but not ready for primetime  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:01): and opensocial integration would be nice  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 15:01): who can tell me someting about "Import from other popular blogging platforms"????  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:02): But desktop widgets we have nothing  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:02): What could be nice is an AIR application  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:02): giving you notifications about what is going on in your wiki  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:02): It could be an addition to the Firefox plugin  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 15:03): Main.Blá Blá Bloom Blin was modified by XWiki.JoaoCarrijo (deleted document) - http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Bl%E1+Bl%E1+Bloom+Blin  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:03): I'll create a Open Social integration project  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 15:03): Main.Blá Blá Bloom was modified by XWiki.JoaoCarrijo (deleted document) - http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Bl%E1+Bl%E1+Bloom  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:03): Hai ldubost  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 15:03): hi XKLL, you had questions about the blog import project?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:04): ldubost : Hi ldubost  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:04): ldubost : Have some issues with the Google docs integration Project  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:04): I need some feedback of my Survey application ideas  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:04): I had installed the Old google docs integration.!!   
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:05): everything is fine.   
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:05): i goes connects to spreadsheet   
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:05): If u r busy drop me a mail  
XKLL - (24/03/2009 15:05): yes. but i do not know much about blogging platforms. can you give me a example?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:05): but not fethching the data  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 15:05): GoogleSummerOfCode.GoogleGadgetsandOpenSocialIntegration was modified by xwiki:XWiki.LudovicDubost - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/GoogleGadgetsandOpenSocialIntegration  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:05): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/GoogleGadgetsandOpenSocialIntegration  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:06): arunreddy: so it's working fine.. you could test it ?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:06): ldubost :   
XKLL - (24/03/2009 15:06): hi martal  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:06): everything works fine except one thing  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:06): it doesnt show data  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:06): ChathuraPrabuddh I'll look at it  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:07): meanwhile I successfully able to build the platform and the enterprise  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:07): actually.... u fill up some data in spread sheet and that comes in the wiki is taht the use case  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:07): now doing some tutorials  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:07): .?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:09): ldubost : It gives Notice: Requested Document not found after redirecting from the Spreadsheets  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): yes  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): there is a bug  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): look at the url  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): it says Sandbox  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): instead of GoogleDocs  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): replace it  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:09): ok  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:09): :)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:09): and find the wiki page that has the wrong reference :)  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:10): if you load the right URL it will update your wiki table  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:10): ChathuraPrabuddh   A time line would be nice  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:10): and a tentative architecture  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:10): ok thank you ldubost I'm waiting for ur mail to create the a tentative Project architecture or an approach to it:  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:10): showing your way of analysing the modules  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:10): otherwise it's good  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:11): some links to any public work you might have done would be great  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:11): I hope to add some activity diagrams so it will make some good understanding  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:11): thanks  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:12): ldubost : Is this only for sending the tables..?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:13): this is just the URL at the end the retrieves the tables from Google Spreadsheet  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:13): how to view them.?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:14): oh  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:14): it says table successfully sent  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:14): it should have openned your google docs account  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:14): yep  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:14): are you talking about the sending step or the retrieve step  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:15): the document is not showing up in your google docs account ?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:15): am able to send the data .. by loggin in and inserting the data myself  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:15): and it comes back saying table is sent  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:15): how to retrieve the data.?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:16): can you send me a screenshot  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:16): skype: ldubost  or my mail  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:16): ludovic    
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:16): AT   
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:16): xwiki.com  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:16): ldubost I have some question regarding question creation  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:17): I think its good to maintain a question bank  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:18): So we can creat common types of questions which can be reusable  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:18): THat's a good idea  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:19): like getting user information  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:19): form  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:19): right  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:20): any suggestions to improve my work  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:21): mockups  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:21): mockups would help  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:21): we have balsamiq mockups installed here  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:21): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Mockups/WebHome  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:22): thank you.What u think about providing flv upload feature  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:22): based on that they can enhance there survey  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:23): flv is nice.. is there an open source player  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:23): wht u think  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:25): We have a video macro which allows to display a youtube or dailymotion video  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:25): hav to do some search....  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:25): one that can do flv would be nice too  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:27): arunreddy: did you send me a screenshot ?  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:27): ldubost : mailed, kindly chek it out  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:27): ok god it  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:27): :)  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:27): ChathuraPrabuddh : Hi  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): which table did you click on ?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): the one in Recent Changes ?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): that's not so good  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): create a new page  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): put a wiki table in it  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:28): yeah  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:28): ok  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): then edit this one  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:28): and follow the "link"  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:29): THis is one bug that needs to be fixed. .the spreadsheet plugin puts edit links on all tables  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:29): when it should only make real wiki tables editable  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:31): ldubost I had discuss with serigu about providing a spreadsheet function to import survey data  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:31): He said that its bit complex  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:31): like define the survey in a spreadsheet ?  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:32): one thing that is nice is what Google Docs' survey has which is sending the data to the spreadsheet live  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:32): that's nice then to do some custom graphs  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:32): but given the survey we want to do a nice reporting in XWiki should be plenty enought  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:32): enough  
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:33): ldubost : finally got it   
arunreddy - (24/03/2009 15:33): ldubost : Thanks a lot  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:33): mm but the main thing is  the time line  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:35): you can send a mail regarding the most important aspects   
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:36): to me  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 15:37): simple but easy to use and good reporting  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:40): so thanks.. drop me a mail regarding ur ideas,suggestion I'll look at them in next few days  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 15:40): bye  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:47): ldubost, I have taken a look at the google gadgets intergation in wiki pages  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:48): but I'm still more interested in developing widgets for different platforms that give u information about your wikis  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:49): what do you mean that I can get data by using wiki scripts?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:50): I thought the only way to get data is by using one of the web services in the .js file of the widget  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:50): :)  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:55): and I was thinking to concentrate my attention on: what cool information we can display in a widget and user stories  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:56): and another important thing is that I wanna concentrate on the usability...  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:57): hello marta1 :)  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:57): how are you?  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 15:58): hi alexmaru  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 15:59): what do you think about this "widgets" project? :)  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 15:59): well, that's ludovic's proposal, he knows best what he want's from it  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 15:59): :)  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 16:00): \*wants  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 16:00): I need 10mn  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 16:00): finishing a call  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:00): yes, but it's a community... everyone can contribute with ideas, right?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:00): :)  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 16:01): absolutely  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 16:02): ok, let's see what you guys talked about above...  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:04): hmmm, I was thinking about somenthing...  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:05): let's say I develop a widget, and I show a list of the registered users in the wiki  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:05): this can be done by using the REST API and parsing the /XWiki/XWikiUsers page  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:07): I would have to use a complicated URL for getting all the users  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:08): hmmm, wouldn't be nicer to provide a simpler URL?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:11): I mean if I'm a developer and I want to use the REST API and get all the users in a wiki... I wouldn't know how to this just by consulting the API documentation  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:11): if I don't have some experience with XWiki  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 16:13): ok then, you can start by improving that :)  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 16:14): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 16:14): yes marta1, I was thinking at that  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 16:14): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 16:15): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 16:15): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox  
xwikibot - (24/03/2009 16:16): DevGuide.SearchBox was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SearchBox

ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:50): alexmaru still here ?  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 17:50): yes  
alexmaru - (24/03/2009 17:50): ldubost  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:51): so alex..  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:51): first  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): the REST api is quite generic  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): creating specific apis for each class is much more work  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): indeed it could be interesting to have a "user" REST api  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): but at the same time everything is accesslible using the XWiki.XWikiUsers api  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): Now  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:52): for your widgets  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): the REST api is one usable Api  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): but you can also create some custom web services in xwiki scriptiong  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): scripting  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): XWiki scripting can return HTML or JSON  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): so you can write your custom web service in XWiki scripting  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:53): Then people can install this XAR in their wiki to have the APIs  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:54): for example if you want to make a nice Google Gadget that displays some xwiki content  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:54): it might be more flexible to do it in xwiki scripting  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:54): it's easier to modify  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:54): than doing it in JS + REST  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:54): since Google Gadgets can display HTML  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:55): If you are doing a Gadget in AIR then REST or a Custom API and pure AIR display is probably better  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:55): When you think about it this project is more about finding the relevant information to display  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:55): than actually doing it  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): Then it's about doing the infrastructure module for each target widget platform that we decide to target  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): Each one requires basic work  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): but at the same time most platform can now display HTML  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): iPhone, AIR, Google Gadgets etc..  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): So the main question is :  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): - what is the relevant info  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:56): - good design to show it  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:57): - how often to update it  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:57): - etc..  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:57): And making it extensible easily  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:58): Socialtext has release Socialtext dekstop in AIR  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:58): http://www.socialtext.com/products/desktop.php  
ldubost - (24/03/2009 17:58): you could look into that one

Can you please explain the prerequisites , i am almost conversant with javascript library extjs (actually with its java implementation - gwt-ext), jquery.

siddharthmukherj - (24/03/2009 18:26): hi marta1, are you thinking of paticipating in gsoc 2009.  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:27): about the javascript libaries  
kumuditha - (24/03/2009 18:27): I am a also willing to participate in gsoc 2009, i would like to apply for the Google Docs Integration project  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:28): the think is we'd like to avoid adding new javascript libraries to xwiki  
kumuditha - (24/03/2009 18:28): can someone point me out a starting point  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:28): we're currently using prototype  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:29): are tyou familiar with it, siddharthmukherj?  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 18:29): hai  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (24/03/2009 18:29): start it from here http://www.theserverside.com/tt/articles/article.tss?l=XWiki  
siddharthmukherj - (24/03/2009 18:30): yes only a little, but i can get used to it in a few days. i have seen its api, its much similar to jquery.  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:31): yes, it's pretty easy to adopt  
siddharthmukherj - (24/03/2009 18:34): so marta1 what do you mean by "support microformats" as stated in the calendar application project page  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:36): microformats are the most basic form of semantic markup  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:37): for example, you put the information about an event in an html element with the class "vevent"  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:38): so if an outside agent wants to find the events on your page, it would just look for elements with this class  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:38): http://microformats.org/  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:39): this should be interesting for you: http://microformats.org/wiki/hcalendar  
marta1 - (24/03/2009 18:40): from the implementation point of view, it's no big deal: you just make sure that all the elements are properly marked
